entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 8:56PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS COMBINED WITH FALLING SNOW ALONG THE ALASKA PENINSULA ON SATURDAY... A storm system over the Pacific will pass across the eastern Aleutians tonight, bringing rain and southerly winds gusting 45 to 60 mph. Higher winds to 80 mph are in the Cold Bay area this evening.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 12:54PM AKST until January 14 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG DURATION SNOW EVENT FOR THIS WEEKEND... .Light snow will begin Friday and Friday night into Saturday morning across the northern panhandle and will gradually increase in intensity through the weekend. Snow is expected to start rather dry and fluffy for most areas but may become wetter and heavier along the outer coast as temperatures gradually warm.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 11:24AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Extended Arctic Cold Snap Coming.... Arctic air will soon begin spreading into the region as we head into the holiday weekend. This will eventually help change rain over to some brief light snow in some places just before it ends, and it will offer sub freezing air for any moisture that lingers despite the wind`s drying effect.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 11:24AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Extended Arctic Cold Snap Coming.... Arctic air will soon begin spreading into the region as we head into the holiday weekend. This will eventually help change rain over to some brief light snow in some places just before it ends, and it will offer sub freezing air for any moisture that lingers despite the wind`s drying effect.

entry.title: Avalanche Warning issued January 12 at 12:09PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Bridger-Teton Avalanche Center in Jackson has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING which is in effect until 10 PM MST Saturday... * WHAT...The combination of strong winds and new snow falling on a weak snowpack will create widespread areas of unstable snow. Avalanche danger is High with very dangerous avalanche
entry.cap:areaDesc: Jackson Hole; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Star Valley; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains

entry.title: Avalanche Watch issued January 11 at 8:51PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Bridger-Teton Avalanche Center in Jackson has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH which is in effect until 5 AM MST Friday... * WHAT...The combination of strong winds and new snow falling on a weak snowpack will create widespread areas of unstable snow. Avalanche danger is expected to rise to High tomorrow with very dangerous avalanche
entry.cap:areaDesc: Jackson Hole; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Star Valley; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains
